DOC.brief_summary: This study assess acceptability effectiveness six-session , modular , repeat group low-income woman symptom depression and/or post-traumatic stress disorder follow interpersonal trauma exposure .
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study assess acceptability effectiveness six-session , modular , repeat group low-income woman symptom depression and/or post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) follow interpersonal trauma exposure . Group participant recruit public sector/safety net primary care clinic . Study participant randomize immediate delay treatment . Participants condition receive information PTSD depression , form brochure DVD trauma emotional consequence . Groups comprise three component meeting : psycho-education , current relationship issue , cop skill . Each group session focus different aspect education . Next , relationship difficulty typically associate symptom discuss module address , group discussion participant ' relationship difficulty . Each group end therapist teach cop skill fit issue discuss earlier . Participants free attend session miss first group group repeat . Participants delayed condition able attend group 12-week wait period . Assessments PTSD , depression , functioning , quality life conduct three time point : baseline ( prior start group ) , 12 week start group , 6 month start group . Gift card send woman complete assessment .
DOC.criteria: Exposure interpersonal traumatic event Diagnosis depression PTSD ( threshold subthreshold ) Functional literacy Apparent incoherence disorientation Apparent intoxication recruitment Hearing impairment
